title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Apple’s India sales hit record $9 billion after retail expansion
items.summary: - Apple’s India sales near *$9B*, up ~13% to last fiscal year, per Bloomberg.\n- *iPhones* led demand as retail expands in Bengaluru and Pune, with Noida/Mumbai on the way, and India designated a separate sales region.\n- Apple is increasing *Made-in-India* production (about 20% of iPhones) to serve the US market, while high import taxes keep prices high, prompting discounts and trade-ins in the market.

items.title: GST cut to lower renewable project costs; hike in oil, gas rates to raise upstream burden
Clean energy installs to get cheaper after GST cut
items.summary:
- The GST on renewable energy devices and parts is cut from *12%* to *5%*, aiming to promote adoption of *green power*. 
- The rate cut applies to PV cells, solar modules, solar power devices, wind generators, etc., with refunds for inverted duty structure. 
- Industry leaders say lower costs will boost demand, accelerate capacity addition, attract investment, and support India's 2030 clean-energy targets.

items.title: GST cut on renewables boosts investor confidence
items.summary:
- The GST reduction from 12% to 5% on renewable energy equipment lowers project costs and eases long-standing tax credit issues, boosting *investor confidence*. 
- Industry leaders expect improved tariff competitiveness and faster deployment of *solar, wind, hybrid, and storage* projects nationwide. 
- The reform is seen as a boon for domestic manufacturing, reducing unutilised GST credits and supporting India's 2030 target of 500 GW non-fossil capacity.

items.title: Cadence Design to buy Hexagon's design and engineering unit for $3.16 billion
items.summary: - *Cadence Design* to buy *Hexagon AB*'s *D&E* unit for **€2.7B** (~$3.16B), with **70% cash** and the rest in shares.\n- The deal broadens *Cadence Design*'s customers (Nvidia, Qualcomm; VW, BMW, Lockheed Martin) and adds *Hexagon's D&E* software for *structural and multibody dynamics*; 2024 revenue ~**€265M** and 1,100+ employees.\n- Closure expected in *Q1 2026*; reverse termination fee up to **€175M**; follows *BETA CAE Systems* acquisition.

items.title: NITI Aayog pushes early 2D materials for semiconductors
items.summary:
- *NITI Aayog* calls for an early push to develop **2D materials** for semiconductors to gain leadership rather than play catch-up.
- 2D materials are reportedly about 8 lakh times thinner than a pencil tip, far stronger than steel, and could enable chips up to 10x smaller than today’s smallest nodes.
- The push urges investing in people, R&D, supply chains, standards, and alliances to build a home-grown ecosystem and secure a first-mover edge in semiconductors.

items.title: Texas Instruments flags demand slowdown after tariff-driven spike
Chinese firms still want Nvidia chips despite government pressure not to buy
CynLr and IISc partner on neuroscience-led robotics research
items.summary:
- The collaboration, Visual Neuroscience for Cybernetics, will apply *neuroscience* insights on depth and motion to *robotic vision systems* that learn without prior training. 
- CynLr and IISc’s *Vision Lab* (led by Professor *SP Arun*) will drive joint research, algorithm development and training, with doctoral and early-career researchers joining CynLr. 
- Building on CynLr’s global track (EPFL, CSEM) to develop adaptable robots for real-world complexity; the program remains open to other academic partners.

items.title: Tata Electronics, Merck sign MoU to boost India semiconductors
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The **MoU** enables Tata Electronics and **Merck** to collaborate on semiconductor materials, fabrication infrastructure, and specialty chemicals and gases in India.
- **Merck** will supply its portfolio—high-purity electronic materials, advanced gas and chemical delivery systems, turnkey fab infrastructure, and Athinia data analytics—to Tata Electronics’ planned **Dholera fab**, along with safety and manufacturing best practices.
- The partnership includes localised warehousing, supply chain development, talent cultivation, and industry standards; it supports the **India Semiconductor Mission**; Tata Electronics will build India's first fab in **Dholera** with about ₹91,000 crore, producing chips for automotive, mobile, and AI applications.

items.title: India looking beyond US for pharma exports amid tariff tensions
items.summary:
- *India* is seeking to diversify pharma exports beyond the US by targeting semi-regulated markets in Africa, Latin America and Southeast Asia to reduce tariff risk.
- *Pharmexcil* plans to push finished-drug sales to *China* to bridge the trade deficit, as India imports over 60% of its raw materials and APIs from China.
- The US remains India’s largest pharma market, but tariff tensions persist; India is also eyeing growth in other markets, including Russia, the Netherlands and Brazil.

items.title: JSW Cement to boost capacity 65% by 2028
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - *JSW Cement* will raise capacity by *65%* to about *34 million tonnes* by 2028, with EBITDA per tonne targeted at *₹1,150–1,200* and capex around *₹2,000 crore*.\n- The group is pursuing *greenfield and brownfield expansions* to reach *33.85 MT by 2028*, plus plans to hit *41.85 MT* later at Vijaynagar and new plants in Hatta (MP) and UP (timeline not specified).\n- It aims to cut costs by up to *₹400/tonne* in 12–18 months (₹200/tonne already achieved), with subsidies in Rajasthan and Punjab and improved EBITDA, while staying behind peers like Nuvoco.

items.title: HCCB signs MoUs for SHINE in Maharashtra
items.summary:
- *Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages* signed MoUs with Pune, Ratnagiri, Palghar and Jalgaon to drive inclusive development under Project SHINE in Maharashtra. 
- The partnerships focus on *women empowerment*, water access, healthcare, education, youth skilling, and include initiatives such as electric vehicles for waste collection and upgrades to schools and health centres. 
- Chief Minister *Devendra Fadnavis* and HCCB executives hailed the collaboration as a catalyst for rural and tribal growth, noting that Project SHINE has already impacted over 1.2 lakh people.

items.title: BGR Tech–Collabrah win Oil India SPF contract
items.summary:
- **BGR Tech** and **Collabrah** won a ₹53.5 crore Oil India Limited contract to deploy six surface production facilities (SPFs) across Assam, under a three-year program with space for additional units.
- The award highlights their ability to deliver complex energy infrastructure and supports India's aim to expand domestic production and reduce import dependence.
- The teams are expanding into *hydrogen* production and *clean-energy EPC* services, eyeing further opportunities with ONGC in regions including Mumbai High, Cauvery Basin, KG Basin, Ahmedabad assets, and the Northeast.

items.title: Apollo Tyres earns 5-star rating at Chennai & Limda
items.summary:
- Apollo Tyres' Chennai and Limda plants earned a *5-star rating* from the *British Safety Council* after a rigorous audit of *health and safety management*. 
- The audit assessed *leadership*, *employee engagement*, *risk management* and *continuous improvement*, with Apollo excelling across all areas and aligning with global benchmarks. 
- The award positions Apollo for the *Sword of Honour Awards*, underscoring a strong *safety culture* and commitment to worker *well-being*.

items.title: SEMICON India 2025: Odisha outlines semiconductor and electronics vision
India adds 30 GW renewable energy generation capacity so far in 2025: Minister
European gas prices dip on strong supply, high storage levels
UP CM Yogi attends Bhoomi Pujan ceremony of Amrit Bottlers’ Coca-Cola bottling plant in Gorakhpur
South Africa's Aspen aims for profit turnaround with insulin, GLP-1 drugs
Garuda Aerospace eyes ₹365 crore revenue in FY26; gears up for unicorn leap
GST cut on solar, wind gear to 5% boosts green energy
Relief for exporters: GST Council clears speedy refunds for claims below ₹1,000
Madhya Pradesh CM warns collectors over fertiliser chaos
Ashwini Vaishnaw inaugurates TDK’s ₹3,000 crore lithium-ion battery plant in Haryana
US seizes meth precursor chemicals from China
items.summary:
- The US seized over *700,000 pounds* of *meth precursor chemicals* en route from **China** to the **Sinaloa cartel**, officials said.
- The chemicals would have made about *420,000 pounds of meth* with a street value of **$569 million** in **Houston**.
- The operation involved foreign partners and underscores US efforts to curb illicit drug networks and precursor shipments.

items.title: ALEMAI calls for higher domestic aluminium extrusion demand
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The *ALEMAI* calls for measures to boost domestic *aluminium extrusion* demand to curb import reliance and tariff risk.
- It notes India has 3 million tpa capacity but only ~1.2 million utilisation, with imports over 1.5 million tonnes driven by price gaps, FTAs and duty-free access for value-added products.
- It urges government support, excluding aluminium extrusion downstream products from FTAs, safeguards against low-cost imports, and higher billet production by *NALCO*, ahead of **ALUMEX India 2025**.

items.title: India needs more fabless chip firms to drive growth
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- **fabless semiconductor companies** drive innovation and growth, says Naveen Yanduru. 
- India needs more local ODMs/OEMs and better customer access and testing to enable fabless firms. 
- Government support exists (Semiconductor Mission, PLI), but funding must translate into tangible outputs, as shown by the Gujarat OSAT pilot.

items.title: China displays unmanned arsenal, anti-drone technology
items.author: Manu Pubby
items.summary: - *Unmanned systems* dominated the parade, including a new large attack drone, manned-unmanned teaming and shipborne stealth helicopter drones.\n- An unmanned 'wingman' that can team with a fighter jet for riskier missions was showcased, signaling advanced aerial tactics.\n- Beijing also displayed a counter-swarm drone system with laser weapons and micro missiles, underscoring a shift to newer warfare techniques.

items.title: GST 2.0 cuts freight taxes to 5% to ease logistics costs
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- The *GST Council* cut freight taxes to 5% for *multimodal transport*, aiming to lower *logistics costs*. 
- Items like *container and rail movement*, *road haulage*, and *Goods Transport Agency services* now face 5% without ITC or 18% with ITC, affecting *door-to-door cargo charges*. 
- The change could reduce transport costs for exporters, but firms must balance lower rates without ITC against higher slabs with credit, with *no Compensation Cess*.

items.title: GST 2.0 FAQs: Impact on cars, EVs & FMCG
items.summary:
- *GST 2.0*, effective *Sep 22, 2025*, simplifies taxes into *5%*, *18%*, and *40%* slabs with exemptions to reduce disputes.
- Small cars see relief with *18%* GST and *EVs* retain *5%* to spur adoption.
- Broader shifts include *40%* on luxury items, *18%* on auto parts, *5%* on tractors, and *insurance premiums* exempt, with ongoing compensation cess for states.

items.title: Why India wants to mine its own waste for minerals
items.author: Saurav Anand; ETEnergyWorld
items.summary: - *India approves a ₹1,500 crore incentive scheme to boost **critical mineral recycling**, aiming to cut imports and build a *circular economy*.\n- *The plan targets 270 kt/year recycling capacity and 40 kt/year mineral recovery, with subsidies under the **NCMM** framework.*\n- *Experts say recycling is the fastest path to domestic mineral security, aiding the EV ecosystem and clean energy transition while creating green jobs.*

items.title: LTSCT, IISc Sign MoU for National 2D Hub
items.summary:
- LTSCT and IISc will establish India's first National 2D Innovation Hub to advance **2D material-based semiconductors** and **quantum technologies**.
- The hub will enable wafer-scale fabrication facilities, process design kits and prototypes, backed by **industry–academia–government** collaboration.
- IISc will anchor the program with fabrication facilities and translational research, building partnerships across defence, aerospace and energy.

items.title: AI rivals gain from data-sharing order vs Google
items.summary: - A US court order requiring Google to share search data could help *AI firms* gain ground against **Google**, though matching its dominance will take substantial time and resources.\n- The ruling aims to level the playing field, but Google's distribution power via partnerships and default options remains strong, keeping entry costs high for rivals.\n- Even with data access, building a consumer‑facing product will demand *massive capital* and time, with startups like *OpenAI* and *Perplexity* racing to offer competing AI search features.

items.title: Mother Dairy to pass on GST cuts to consumers
items.summary:
- *Mother Dairy* will pass on the **GST rate cuts** on a wide range of dairy products to consumers.
- The relief covers paneer, cheese, ghee, butter, UHT milk, milk-based beverages and ice creams, boosting affordability and access.
- MD Manish Bandlish says the reform will spur demand for packaged value-added dairy products and help families enjoy quality dairy at better value.

items.title: Punjab floods: Kapurthala boat maker aids relief
items.summary:
- A Kapurthala-based firm, Hanspal Traders, is manufacturing and delivering **boats** to aid relief and rescue operations in flood-hit **Punjab**. 
- Founder Pritpal Singh Hanspal says he has supplied about *50 boats* in one week and published boat designs to enable small factories to replicate them. 
- Relief work is led by **NDRF**, the Army, **BSF** and district authorities, using boats to reach flooded villages and evacuate people and livestock.

items.title: RIR to set up ₹618 cr SiC facility in Odisha
items.author: Suraksha P
items.summary:
- RIR Power Electronics plans a ₹618 crore **SiC** facility in Bhubaneswar, with *Phase I* on epitaxial wafer growth and Phase II to fab high‑voltage MOSFETs, IGBTs and diodes. 
- The Odisha government will provide about half the investment as *fiscal incentives* and land support. 
- The project aims to advance India’s *SiC power electronics* ecosystem and align with ISM 2.0 goals, boosting long‑term manufacturing capacity.

items.title: GST on electrolysers cut to 5% and green hydrogen costs
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- *GST cut* on electrolysers from 18% to 5% could substantially lower the *cost of green hydrogen*, since electrolysers and BOP account for 30–40% of production costs.
- This aligns with India's *National Green Hydrogen Mission* to reach 5 million tonnes/year by 2030 and ₹19,744 crore in incentives to boost manufacturing and exports.
- State projects (Andhra Pradesh, Amaravati Declaration) and tenders for green ammonia indicate growing capacity and *export ambitions*, with hydrogen prices falling from ₹460/kg to about ₹160/kg by decade-end.

items.title: India aims 5% SAF blend by 2030
items.summary: - *SAF* blending target: 5% by 2030, with 1% by 2027 and 2% by 2028.\n- *CO2* reductions up to 80%; India has biomass and residue capacity to meet demand and potentially export.\n- Supported by ICAO and the EU, the initiative will shape a national SAF policy and ecosystem.

items.title: Hidden methane from Australian coal boosts steel impact
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- The Ember study finds *methane emissions* from Australian coal mines are underreported and could raise steelmaking's short-term climate footprint by about 6–15%.
- Australia is the world’s largest exporter of *coking coal*, with 867 kilotonnes of methane emitted in 2023; with methane intensities of 3–5 tonnes per kilotonne of coal, this could add 10–17% to steel’s short-term climate footprint.
- Existing *methane abatement technologies* could cut more than half of emissions, but only if buyers demand transparency at mine level and supplier abatement efforts.

items.title: Cabinet okays ₹1,500 cr scheme to boost critical mineral recycling
items.author: Saurav Anand, ETEnergyWorld
items.summary:
- The Union Cabinet approved a ₹1,500 crore incentive scheme under the *National Critical Mineral Mission (NCMM)* to boost recycling of critical minerals from secondary sources like *e-waste* and *lithium-ion battery scrap* over six years (FY2025-26 to FY2030-31).
- It offers a 20% capex subsidy and an Opex subsidy linked to incremental sales, with caps of ₹50 crore for large entities and ₹25 crore for small units, targeting about *270 kilo tonnes* of annual recycling capacity and ~*40 kilo tonnes* of minerals yearly.
- Officials say the move will strengthen domestic supply chains for *EVs*, renewables and electronics, bridging immediate mineral needs via recycling and attracting around ₹8,000 crore in investment and ~70,000 jobs.

items.title: GST rejig boosts renewables, raises coal costs in India
items.summary:
- The GST overhaul raises *coal* taxes to **18%** while cutting *renewables* to **5%**, signaling higher near‑term tariffs but a cleaner energy path.
- Cheaper renewable equipment and hydrogen tech could lower project costs and speed adoption under the **National Green Hydrogen Mission**.
- Analysts say the move mirrors global trends to disincentivize **fossil fuels** and may accelerate India's shift to clean fuels, with long‑term benefits for consumers and industry.

items.title: US manufacturing contracts sixth straight month on tariffs
items.summary:
- *ISM Manufacturing PMI* rose? No, fell to **48.7** in August, signaling a sixth straight contraction as **tariffs** and policy uncertainty weigh on demand. 
- Seven industries expanded while ten contracted, including **paper products, machinery, electrical equipment, appliances & components**, and **computer and electronic products**. 
- Despite the drag, **AI-related spending** and potential **accelerated depreciation** incentives could cushion investment into 2025–26.

items.title: MOIL posts 17% rise in Aug manganese ore output
items.summary:
- MOIL posted its *highest-ever August production* of **1.45 lakh tonnes**, up **17% YoY**.
- August sales were **1.13 lakh tonnes** with **April-August 2025** production at **7.92 lakh tonnes**, up **9.3% YoY**.
- The Board approved an interim dividend of **Rs 4.02** per share and five shaft projects worth **Rs 886 crore** to boost future output.

items.title: GST Council approves highest tax rate of 40% on these goods
items.summary:
- The GST Council approved moving *sin goods* to a **40% slab** under **GST 2.0**, with a simplified two-slab structure of *5%* and *18%*. 
- Tobacco products will migrate to the **40% slab** after compensation cess loans are discharged; cigarettes currently attract *28% GST plus cess*, with rollout by *Sept 22, 2025*. 
- The 40% list covers *tobacco products*, *sugar-sweetened beverages*, and *luxury cars/SUVs*, with *junk foods* included; alcohol remains outside GST and is taxed by states.

items.title: US warns on UN ship fuel deal, threatens tariffs
items.summary:
- The *United States* has told countries to reject the UN marine fuel emissions deal, warning of **tariffs**, *visa restrictions*, and port levies if it is adopted.
- Washington pulled out of talks in April and warned of retaliation against supporters, saying the measures would burden the shipping industry and do little to reduce emissions.
- The State Department says it is actively exploring remedies including **tariffs**, *visa restrictions*, and/or port levies, and will urge partners to adopt similar measures.

items.title: GST 2.0: Small cars cheaper, luxury EVs costlier
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - *GST 2.0* introduces a simplified two-slab system of *5%* and *18%*, with a special *40%* slab for luxury goods, raising levies on premium cars and high-end EVs.\n- The reform trims rates for small cars and two-wheelers, making them cheaper, while abolishing the cess is expected to ease compliance for automakers.\n- Luxury vehicles and premium EVs face higher levies, potentially slowing demand for high-end EVs from global players.

items.title: Metal stocks rally on China curbs and policy support
items.summary:
- Tata Steel up about *6%* and other metal stocks rally as *China capacity curbs* and policy supports lift *steel prices*. 
- *CLSA* notes suggest steel prices may firm on global recovery and *China's anti-involution*, with the *Nifty Metal* index hitting intraday highs. 
- India’s extension of a *9% safeguard duty* on imported steel and *China cuts* could stabilize supply and help *SAIL*, *Tata Steel* and other domestic producers.

items.title: Elliott pushes PepsiCo turnaround after $4B stake
items.summary:
- *$4B stake* in **PepsiCo** and a call for a soda-business turnaround to lift growth and the share price.
- *Re-franchising bottling* like **Coca-Cola** and possible spin-off of North American bottling are on the table.
- Analysts see the move as a catalyst for quick changes and potential shifts in non-core assets or partnerships as PepsiCo reviews the plan.

items.title: BHARATI: 100 agri-food startups to $50B exports by 2030
items.summary:
- **BHARATI** will empower 100 agri-food startups and push exports toward **$50 billion** by 2030.
- It targets high-value segments like **GI-tagged** products, organics, and superfoods, and leverages **AI**, **blockchain**, and **IoT** to boost quality, traceability, and packaging.
- **APEDA** will partner with state boards, IITs/NITs and accelerators to scale a nationwide incubation program for lasting export growth.
